CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Even though PFDTBT_20Per showed the highest hole mobility among the PFDTBT - based copolymers , it is UV - visible absorption spectrum showed greater blue - shifting than PFDTBT , as shown in Figures 2 and 3 , and it showed the widest band gap energy among all of the polymers considered herein.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph! Here are the entities I found:

1. PFDTBT - This is a material name, as it is a specific type of polymer.
2. PFDTBT_20Per - This is also a material name, as it is a specific variation of the PFDTBT polymer.
3. PFDTBT - This is another instance of the material name "PFDTBT".
4. Figures 2 and 3 - These are references to specific figures in the text that show data related to the materials being discussed.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that clearly refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph:

1. PFDTBT
2. PFDTBT_20Per

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer directly to a specific material name. The other entities (Figures 2 and 3) are references to figures in the text that show data related to the materials, but they are not material names themselves.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PFDTBT |
| PFDTBT_20Per |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Even though PFDTBT_20Per showed the highest hole mobility among the PFDTBT - based copolymers , it is UV - visible absorption spectrum showed greater blue - shifting than PFDTBT , as shown in Figures 2 and 3 , and it showed the widest band gap energy among all of the polymers considered herein.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's break down the paragraph and identify the entities related to "Property Value" one by one:

1. Property: "hole mobility"
	* Entity: PFDTBT_20Per (the polymer with the highest hole mobility)
2. Property: "UV-visible absorption spectrum"
	* Entity: PFDTBT (the polymer whose UV-visible absorption spectrum showed greater blue-shifting)
3. Property: "band gap energy"
	* Entity: all of the polymers considered herein (the polymers whose band gap energy was measured and compared)

So, the "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are:

1. Hole mobility (PFDTBT_20Per)
2. UV-visible absorption spectrum (PFDTBT)
3. Band gap energy (all of the polymers considered herein)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

	* Entity: PFDTBT_20Per (the polymer with the highest hole mobility)
2. Property: "band gap energy"
	* Entity: all of the polymers considered herein (the polymers whose band gap energy was measured and compared)
